text: Milton Viorst (February 18, 1930 December 9, 2022) is an American journalist. He was born New Jersey. He studied at Rutgers University. Viorst is married to author Judith Viorst. From 1956 to 1993, Viorst often worked with The New Yorker, Foreign Affairs, Harper's Magazine, The Atlantic, The New York Times Magazine, The Washington Post, and The Wall Street Journal. In 1968, he signed the "Writers and Editors War Tax Protest" pledge to refuse tax payments in protest against the Vietnam War."Writers and Editors War Tax Protest" January 30, 1968 New York Post His writing landed him on the Nixon list. He died from complications of COVID-19 on December 9, 2022, at the age of 92. ==References== ==Other websites== *Milton Viorst biography via Alliance Française USA *Milton Viorst on ‘The Israel Lobby’ Category:1930 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Journalists from New Jersey Category:Rutgers University alumni
